summary: North Rhine-Westphalia (NRW) is Germany's most populous state, with over 18 million people. It's located in western Germany and is home to many large cities like Cologne, DÃ¼sseldorf, and Dortmund. The state was formed in 1946 after World War II by combining different regions. It has a diverse culture, with customs varying between the Rhineland, Westphalia, and Lippe areas. NRW has a strong economy, contributing the most to Germany's total gross regional domestic product (GRDP).
title: North Rhine-Westphalia
